title: Training does not start [if config path is incorrect]

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
Please state your operating system, env, and which version of DeepLabCut you are using.

OS: Win 10
DeepLabCut Version:2.2b8
Anaconda env used: DLC-CPU

**Describe the problem**
I've created a project with DLC and labeled about 80 frames from 4 different videos (multi-animal). I've checked the labels, which looked good, and started a training dataset. But every time I want to train the network it starts until it says "starting multi-animal training ...." and i see that the CPU is doing some work for a couple of seconds but than it stops and kicks me out of the ipython session so that I'm back in my environment (DLC-CPU). It also creates the trainset95shuffle1 subfolder in the evaluation-results folder but it is empty. No Error message or something similar appears, it just stops. I've checked Hardware requirements and the problem should not be that i don't fulfill them. I'm running the code in the Command Prompt from Windows.

**Code output** 
C:\coding>activate DLC-CPU

(DLC-CPU) C:\coding>ipython
Python 3.7.9 (default, Aug 31 2020, 17:10:11) [MSC v.1916 64 bit (AMD64)]

In [2]: config_path = '/coding/DLC/test/training_dataset/test1-Denis-2020-11-14/config.yaml'

In [3]: deeplabcut.train_network(config_path)

Cheers Denis
